t: From inside the fish Jonah prayed to the Lord*s his God.
He said: “In*pn my distress I called to the Lord,*s and*ld he answered me. From*ln deep in the realm of the dead I called for help, and*ld you listened to my cry.
You*ln hurled me into the depths, into*ld the very heart of the seas, and*ld the currents swirled about me; all*ln your waves and breakers swept*ld over me.
I*ln said, ‘I have been banished from*ld your sight; yet*ln I will look again toward*ld your holy temple.’
The*ln engulfing waters threatened me, the*ld deep surrounded me; seaweed*ld was wrapped around my head.
To*ln the roots of the mountains I sank down; the*ld earth beneath barred me in forever. But*ln you, Lord*s my God, brought*ld my life up from the pit.
“When*pn my life was ebbing away, I*ld remembered you, Lord,*s and*ln my prayer rose to you, to*ld your holy temple.
“Those*pn who cling to worthless idols turn*ld away from God’s love for them.
But*ln I, with shouts of grateful praise, will*ld sacrifice to you. What*ln I have vowed I will make good. I*ld will say, ‘Salvation comes from the Lord*s .’ ”
And*p the Lord*s commanded the fish, and it vomited Jonah onto dry land.
